strategy: Use CatBoost with these settings: iterations=1000, learning_rate=0.02, depth=8. For preprocessing, fill numeric NaN with median, drop columns with >50% missing. Do NOT use get_dummies for categorical columns — instead, pass cat_features parameter to CatBoost. If you get a dtype error, cast categoricals to str first.

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from catboost import CatBoostRegressor

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
validation = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Define target
target = 'SalePrice'

# Drop columns with more than 50% missing values
missing_ratio = train.isnull().mean()
columns_to_drop = missing_ratio[missing_ratio > 0.5].index
train = train.drop(columns=columns_to_drop)
validation = validation.drop(columns=columns_to_drop)
test = test.drop(columns=columns_to_drop)

# Fill numeric NaN with median
numeric_columns = train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns
numeric_columns = numeric_columns[numeric_columns != target]
train[numeric_columns] = train[numeric_columns].fillna(train[numeric_columns].median())
validation[numeric_columns] = validation[numeric_columns].fillna(validation[numeric_columns].median())
test[numeric_columns] = test[numeric_columns].fillna(test[numeric_columns].median())

# Convert categorical columns to string (in case of dtype errors)
categorical_columns = train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns
for col in categorical_columns:
    train[col] = train[col].astype(str)
    validation[col] = validation[col].astype(str)
    test[col] = test[col].astype(str)

# Identify categorical columns for CatBoost
cat_features = train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns.tolist()

# Prepare features and target
X_train = train.drop(columns=[target])
y_train = train[target]

X_val = validation.drop(columns=[target])
y_val = validation[target]

X_test = test.copy()

# Train CatBoost model with improved hyperparameters
model = CatBoostRegressor(
    iterations=1000,
    learning_rate=0.02,
    depth=8,
    verbose=False
)
model.fit(X_train, y_train, cat_features=cat_features)

# Predict on test set
y_pred_test = model.predict(X_test)

# Create submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test['Id'],
    'SalePrice': y_pred_test
})

# Save
